channel.title: How you found Black Mesa
channel.description:
Tell us how you found Black Mesa in the first place. And maybe a date to go with it. :smiley:
Personally, I found Black Mesa when reading up about hacking techniques (I'm just interested for you troll's out there). I saw that someone had hacked the Black Mesa website in an attempt to get some attention. I searched up Black Mesa, took a look and liked it. Then proceeding to forget about it for a year or so. I found it again in late 2007, and here I am.

item.title: How you found Black Mesa
item.dc:creator: Kepler
item.description:
iKy:

what kind of party was that ? or you just normally speak about half life mods while being drunk

Probably the latest reply ever, but i think it was a Lan Party

item.title: How you found Black Mesa
item.dc:creator: Texter
item.description:
I’ve known about this mod since THIS thread on Half-life2.net, so that’s since October 13, 2004.

jheaddon:

I for one would love to start a modification team that, upon HL1:Source’s release start to go about fully overhauling the original single player.

I have past modification experience and work with design documents for modifications and the like. Therefore I know well enough that this project must be taken about very delicately. Half-Life succeeded for what it was, changing that drastically would remove the very elements that made it what it is.

Wow…almost 8 years ago…

Read full topic

item.title: How you found Black Mesa
item.dc:creator: Bloodshot
item.description:
If it’s any consolation most of the members that have been here for a while are smarter than a large portion of my RL friends and I have spent a lot of time on my computer over the years so It’s probably a similar situation.

Though to be fair, I actually have been on my computer a lot less lately, a side effect of discovering the joys of actually having a life outside video games.

Read full topic

item.title: How you found Black Mesa
item.dc:creator: k3nny1550
item.description:
Personally, I’m glad Catz is back. I like seeing the rest of the old forumites getting back together over common interests- namely the impending release of the mod.

Weirdly enough, I’ve probably hung out with this forum more than my actual real life friends in terms of sheer time invested.

I know, I know, I need a life. Working on it. But it’s nice to have a set of vitriolic, boisterous friends I can talk to at any time on my computer despite being strangers scattered across the world. Heck, some of my irl friends call me by my net handle instead of my name sometimes.

Read full topic

item.title: How you found Black Mesa
item.dc:creator: Bloodshot
item.description:
I randomly stumbled across BM in late 2005. Didn’t join the forums until a couple of months after the cancelled 2009 release.

Read full topic

item.title: How you found Black Mesa
item.dc:creator: CatzEyes93
item.description:
CPU:

Read some small article in 2005 that brought my attention to it and decided to join the forums. The database got wiped out and I didn’t re-register for a long time. I remember Catzeyes93 was in a forum on another site with me and she was so excited in early 2007 about getting a voice acting job with the mod.
[align=center][/align]

I do believe that would have been gamernode? That was back when even winged-one liked me.

Read full topic

item.title: How you found Black Mesa

item.description:
planethalflife.com introduced me to the mod way back in 05 or so signed up here not long after lol…oh the memories of the last eight years. Things have changed so much

Read full topic

item.title: How you found Black Mesa
item.dc:creator: Adurnas
item.description:
I had bought the orange box 2 years ago, after having played hl2 with the various episodes, I decided to try the original hl. After having finished it, I was looking on internet for some random hl clip, and found the 2009 trailer, so I went and had a look at the forum.

item.title: How you found Black Mesa
item.dc:creator: Paradox
item.description:
How I found this site/mod was looking for a good HL2 mod. Saw it on YouTube and thought: “Holy crap. Can finally play HL1 for the first time!” Yes, I’ve never played the first one but have been watching ‘Freeman’s Mind’ to learn.

Read full topic

item.title: How you found Black Mesa
item.dc:creator: Capt_Quark
item.description:
My discovery goes back when it was first announced on planethalflife.com WAY back when the first teaser trailer and first screenshots were released. Been following it ever since.

item.title: How you found Black Mesa
item.dc:creator: ciorex
item.description:
I think I was looking for midget porn and happened upon a link about HL source, and then something about a remake of the original HL with the source engine that was supposedly way better than HL source.

So a few clicks later I ended up on an earlier version of the forum and liked what I saw. In retrospect if someone had told me it would take this long to make I probably would of lost interest in it, but then I’ll have to wait for time travel to be invented so I can go tell my past self to keep looking for the midget porn instead of investigating that link.

Read full topic

item.title: How you found Black Mesa
item.dc:creator: Termo543
item.description:
Google. I typed hardcore porn and this was the first thing to pop up. “Black Mesa Source” sounded pretty kinky. I clicked here, looked at some screenies, watched the trailer, and orgasm-ed the whole way. I was satisfied both physically and mentally.

Read full topic
